intro: Pilea solandri, commonly known as the Chinese money plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Araceae. It is native to China and is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that resemble small coins. The plant produces small, inconspicuous white flowers that are followed by bright red berries. It is a popular houseplant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care. Pilea solandri prefers indirect light and well-draining soil, making it suitable for indoor cultivation.
